title: What’s in a name? 22 days in jail and a 17-year legal battle
content: Rajveer Singh Yadav was wrongly arrested due to a clerical error that swapped his name with his brother's, leading to a 17-year legal battle. Despite police admitting the mistake early on, the case dragged through the courts, devastating Rajveer's life and his family's well-being. A Mainpuri court has finally acquitted him, ordering action against the negligent officers responsible for his suffering and lost opportunities.

title: PK-Chirag deal? Pappu Yadav 'connects dots'; asks Prashant Kishore to name CM face
content: Amid concerns over Bihar's law and order, Pappu Yadav alleged a coalition between Chirag Paswan and Prashant Kishore for the upcoming elections, urging Kishore to declare Paswan as the chief ministerial candidate. Paswan expressed his shame over the uncontrolled crime, triggering reactions from alliance partners.

title: Zuckerberg hires ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia to lead Meta’s superintelligence lab
content: Mark Zuckerberg has announced Shengjia Zhao as the chief scientist of Meta Superintelligence Labs. Zhao co-created ChatGPT. He also played a key role in developing GPT-4. Meta has invested heavily in AI talent acquisition. The company has hired talents from Google, OpenAI, Apple and Anthropic. Meta will also spend billions on AI data centers in the US.

title: IND vs ENG 4th Test: Shubman Gill scripts history becomes first-ever to...
content: Shubman Gill made history at Old Trafford, becoming the first Asian batter to surpass 700 runs in a Test series in England. His consistent performance, including four half-centuries and two centuries, has been crucial for India.

title: Raj Thackeray enters 'Matoshree' after 13 yrs to greet Uddhav on birthday
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray visited Uddhav Thackeray to wish him a happy 65th birthday, weeks after their joint rally where they embraced, signaling a moment of unity. Uddhav also received greetings from INDIA bloc allies, including Rahul Gandhi and MK Stalin, who praised his stance on linguistic identity. The leaders had previously united at the 'Awaz Marathicha' rally.

title: From tunnel to Turkey: How Hamas leader Sinwar’s widow escaped and remarried
content: Reports suggest Yahya Sinwar's widow, Samar Abu Zamer, entered Hamas tunnels with children and later fled to Turkey using a fake passport. This evacuation of high-ranking Hamas officials' families, facilitated by falsified documents and external support, has fueled resentment among Gazan residents facing dire conditions. While some leaders' families have reportedly left, others remain, highlighting a growing divide in commitment.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman admits he is ‘scared’ to use AI: ‘I don’t know who is…’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed concerns about the rapid advancement of AI, admitting his own apprehension about using certain AI tools due to data privacy concerns. He acknowledged the intense competition among AI companies and the potential for AI to reshape society, while also addressing fears about job displacement and the need for adaptation in a future dominated by AI.

title: A beginning but with caution: Sitharaman hints at easing India-China economic ties
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman indicated a potential thaw in India-China business relations, citing mutual interest in reviving economic engagement after years of tension. Following S Jaishankar's visit, both nations are exploring avenues for increased interaction and potential easing of investment restrictions. While cautious optimism prevails, progress is also noted in bilateral trade talks with the US and EU.

title: Russian railway power hit: Ukrainian attack delays trains; 99 drones downed
content: Ukrainian drones, intercepted by Russian air defenses over the Volgograd region, caused damage to railway power lines, disrupting train services. The incident prompted the temporary suspension of flight operations at Volgograd Airport. While no injuries were reported, the attacks are part of Ukraine's retaliation against Russia's aggression, targeting infrastructure critical to its war efforts.

title: China's BYD to assemble EVs in Pakistan; VP BYD Pakistan says, 'Do not forsee...'
content: BYD is planning to launch its first Pakistan-assembled car by July or August 2026, aiming to capitalize on the growing demand for electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles. The plant, a joint venture with Mega Motor Company, will initially produce 25,000 units annually, focusing on the domestic market with potential exports to right-hand drive countries.

title: Eastern Congo: Islamic State-backed group attacks church; 21 killed
content: A tragic incident occurred in eastern Congo. Islamic State-backed rebels attacked a church. The attack resulted in the death of at least 21 people. The Allied Democratic Force is suspected of carrying out the assault. Several houses and shops were also set ablaze during the violence. The Congolese army has confirmed the incident and a lower death toll.

title: ‘Power line fell on crowd’: What triggered stampede at Haridwar temple; 8 dead
content: Tragedy struck at the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar, where a stampede claimed the lives of at least six people. The incident occurred amidst a large gathering of devotees. District Magistrate Mayur Dixit confirmed the fatalities, while Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his condolences and assured full support.

title: Thane woman poisons 3 minor daughters to death
content: In Maharashtra's Thane district, a 27-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly poisoning her three young daughters due to distress over domestic issues. Sandhya Sandeep Bere reportedly mixed pesticide in a rice and lentil dish, leading to the girls' hospitalization and subsequent deaths. Autopsy reports confirmed the presence of poison, prompting a murder case and her arrest.

title: Actor Madhampatty Rangaraj marries stylist Joy Crizildaa again; announces pregnancy
content: Actor Madhampatty Rangaraj, known for 'Mehandi Circus' and 'Cooku with Comali,' has remarried celebrity stylist Joy Crizildaa, who announced they are expecting a child in 2025. The announcement has sparked controversy due to Rangaraj's existing marriage, as his first wife, Shruthi Rangaraj, maintains they are still married, creating public attention and speculation.

title: Russian navy parade: Kremlin cancels annual event; cites security reasons
content: Russia has cancelled its annual Navy Day parade, citing security concerns amid heightened tensions and increased Ukrainian strikes on Russian naval assets since the 2022 invasion. The parade, traditionally held in St. Petersburg, is a significant event showcasing Russia's naval power and geopolitical presence, often attended by high-ranking officials and President Putin.

title: MP horror: Woman raped repeatedly on pretext of 'exorcism' in Rewa
content: In Rewa district, a 32-year-old woman was allegedly raped multiple times by a close relative under the guise of exorcism. The accused, a 45-year-old man, reportedly filmed the initial assault and later repeated the act, threatening her into silence.

title: Israel intercepts aid boat on way to Gaza; 'kidnaps' 19 activists, 2 journalists
content: Israeli forces intercepted the 'Handala,' a vessel from the Freedom Flotilla Coalition, aiming to breach Gaza's maritime blockade. The boat, carrying 19 activists and journalists, was seized in international waters and escorted to Ashdod Port. The coalition claims the crew has been "kidnapped," while Israel defends its actions, citing security concerns and calling the attempt unlawful.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ BO collection day 10 (Live): Mohit Suri’s film eyes Rs 250 crore mark
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a box office success, crossing Rs 220 crore. The film has earned Rs 228.93 crore in ten days and is moving towards the Rs 250 crore mark. 'Saiyaara' has become the second highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025, praised for its emotional story, music, and performances.

title: Mumbai bizman jailed for kissing bank officer; gets 1-year RI, Rs 1k fine
content: A Mumbai businessman, Narendra Sagvekar, has been sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment for outraging the modesty of a female bank employee. The incident occurred during an address verification visit to Sagvekar's residence. The magistrate's court found the woman's testimony credible, despite defense arguments of a false complaint.

title: India signs up for 3-day UN meet for peaceful Palestine
content: India is set to participate in the UN high-level conference addressing the Palestine question and the two-state solution, co-chaired by France and Saudi Arabia. Despite US warnings against participation, India hopes the conference will pave the way for concrete steps towards a two-state solution, advocating for an immediate ceasefire and hostage release.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce baby name revelation: Missouri newborn named “Kelce Taylor”
content: In a heartwarming tribute to Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, a newborn girl has been named Kelce Taylor at Liberty Hospital in Missouri. Born on July 25, 2025, the baby was welcomed as "the youngest Swiftie," adorned in a Kelce jersey. This unique name reflects the couple's significant impact on their fans, blending the worlds of pop music and football.

title: After Chirag's Bihar crime remarks, RDJ asks why he is in alliance with Nitish govt
content: Following Union Minister Chirag Paswan's criticism of Bihar's rising crime rates, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) accused him of hypocrisy. RJD MP Manoj Jha urged Paswan, citing his close ties with Prime Minister Modi, to request a fact-finding team to assess Bihar's law and order.

title: Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi on 'Khelo Bharat Niti 2025' - 'Villages, poor and...'
content: Prime Minister Modi announced the 'Khelo Bharat Niti 2025' during his 'Mann Ki Baat' address, emphasizing integrating sports into schools and colleges and supporting sports startups. The policy aims to transform India into a global sporting powerhouse, focusing on grassroots development, infrastructure, and technology.

title: Air India plane crash: Anxiety soars among frequent flyers, say psychiatrists
content: Following the Air India crash in Ahmedabad, fear of flying has surged, impacting even seasoned travelers. Mental health experts attribute this rise to recent flight incidents and constant exposure to disturbing news on social media. Many passengers are now experiencing travel anxiety, altering travel plans, and seeking therapy to manage their fears before boarding flights.

title: 2-day TN visit: PM Modi offers prayers at Chola temple; holds roadshow in Gangaikonda Cholapuram
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated the birth anniversary of Chola emperor Rajendra Chola I at the Gangaikonda Cholapuram Temple in Tamil Nadu, offering prayers and participating in the Aadi Thiruvathirai Festival. He also visited an exhibition on Chola Shaivism and architecture, highlighting Rajendra Chola's maritime expeditions and the temple's significance as a cultural and spiritual hub.

title: 'Nahi khelunga': Dhawan snaps at reporter over India vs Pak question | Watch
content: Shikhar Dhawan faced scrutiny after a reporter questioned his participation in a potential India-Pakistan semi-final at the World Championship of Legends, a query he rebuffed due to his earlier withdrawal from a league match against Pakistan. This decision, influenced by public backlash, drew criticism from Pakistani ex-cricketers, adding tension to the possibility of a high-stakes semi-final clash.

title: Pune rave party busted: Eknath Khadse’s son-in-law among 7 detained
content: Pune police raided an apartment in Kharadi early Sunday, seizing drugs, hookah setups, and liquor, leading to the detention of seven individuals. Among those detained was Pranjal Khewalkar, the husband of Rohini Khadse, daughter of NCP (SP) leader Eknath Khadse. Khadse has called for an investigation into potential political motives behind the raid.

title: 'Hand hanging by thread': Indian-origin man attacked by gang with machete in Melbourne
content: Saurabh Anand, an Indian-origin man, was brutally attacked by a teen machete gang in Melbourne, resulting in severe injuries. The attack occurred at Central Square Shopping Centre in Altona Meadows, leaving Anand with a severed hand, head injuries, and broken bones. Doctors managed to reattach his hand after extensive surgery, while several teenagers were arrested in connection with the assault.

title: Ayodhya shocker: 17-year-old hacks sister to death with axe for talking to male friend
content: In Ayodhya, a tragic incident unfolded as a 17-year-old boy allegedly murdered his 22-year-old sister with an axe following an argument over her phone conversation with a male acquaintance. The dispute escalated rapidly, leading to the fatal attack while they were alone at home.

title: Stephen Curry’s wife sparks heartwarming buzz: Shares Instagram moment with kids
content: Ayesha and Stephen Curry, celebrated for their dedication to family, recently marked their daughter Riley's 13th birthday with a visit to Universal Studios Hollywood. Ayesha shared a heartwarming Instagram post, capturing a tender moment with her children. Despite their demanding careers, the couple consistently prioritizes quality time with their four kids: Riley, Ryan, Canon, and Caius.

title: Israel announces military activity halt for aid in Gaza; suspends combat in 3 areas
content: The Israel Defence Forces have declared a daily "tactical pause" in military operations across key Gaza regions, including Muwasi, Deir al-Balah, and Gaza City, from 10 am to 8 pm local time. This decision aims to address escalating humanitarian concerns and facilitate aid delivery to the population.

title: IND vs ENG | Weather Updates: Will rain save India or complicate their fightback?
content: Team India faces a tense final day in the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford, trailing by 137 runs. The weather forecast predicts rain, potentially disrupting play and influencing the match's outcome. While rain could help India secure a draw, intermittent breaks might favour England's pace attack, posing a challenge to India's batting lineup.

title: 'Different PM, different BJP': Congress slams Modi over Operation Sindoor
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has criticized Prime Minister Modi's leadership in light of the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor, drawing a contrast with Atal Bihari Vajpayee's response to the Kargil War. Ramesh highlighted the absence of a similar review committee and questioned the government's handling of security failures.

title: 'Beyond this pair, I wouldn't be too hopeful': Ex-India cricketer outlines Day 5 challenge
content: Sanjay Manjrekar lauded KL Rahul and Shubman Gill's resilient 174-run partnership against England, highlighting their restraint and mental fortitude after India's shaky start. Despite their aggressive IPL backgrounds, they curbed instincts to bat time, showcasing remarkable discipline. Experts emphasise the critical nature of the first 30 minutes and the new ball on Day 5 for India's survival.

title: Bengaluru heist in 18 seconds: Armed robbers threaten staff at gunpoint
content: In a swift 18-second heist, three masked individuals, one brandishing a gun, robbed Sri Ram Jewellers in Madanayakanahalli, Bengaluru Rural, late Friday night. The perpetrators made off with 150 grams of gold ornaments, as the shop owner and his associate were preparing to secure the items for the night.

title: China moves ahead with its mega dam project - Will India's response face local resistance?
content: Tensions escalate in the Eastern Himalayas as India and China pursue massive dam projects on the Brahmaputra River. Local communities in Arunachal Pradesh resist India's Siang Upper Multipurpose Project, fearing environmental damage and displacement. The project is a strategic response to China's dam construction upstream, raising concerns about water diversion and regional stability.

title: Mann ki Baat: PM Modi hails Shubhanshu Shukla and Chandrayaan 3; top quotes from 124th episode
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his 124th Mann ki Baat episode, highlighted India's achievements in science and culture. He mentioned astronaut Sudhanshu Shukla's return from the International Space Station and the excitement surrounding Chandrayaan-3's success. PM Modi also noted the rise of space startups and announced August 23 as National Space Day, inviting suggestions via the Namo App.

title: Noida shocker: 5-year-old girl killed as speeding BMW car rams into two-wheeler
content: In a tragic incident in Noida's Sector 30, a 5-year-old girl died after a BMW collided with a scooty on Saturday night. The collision also left two others critically injured. Noida Police have arrested two students, Yash Sharma and Abhishek Rawat, in connection with the accident, and the involved BMW has been seized.

title: Telangana car crash: Two Andhra Pradesh intel officers killed in accident
content: Two Andhra Pradesh intelligence officers, DSPs M Chakradhar Rao and J Shanta Rao, tragically died in a road accident on National Highway-65 in Choutuppal. Their SUV collided with a median and then crashed into a truck while en route from Vijayawada to Hyderabad to oversee routine firing and fitness tests.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Wrapped in cotton wool' - Ex-England batter on why Stokes didn't bowl
content: Doubts surround captain Ben Stokes' absence from England's bowling attack on Day 4 of the fourth Test against India at Old Trafford, despite his earlier century. Former England batter Jonathan Trott suggests medical advice might be the reason behind Stokes' non-participation, considering his history of injuries and the upcoming Ashes tour.

title: Heavy rainfall lashes parts of Mumbai; IMD issues red & orange alerts
content: Mumbai experienced heavy rainfall, prompting a yellow alert from the IMD, while Raigad was under an orange alert. In Madhya Pradesh, torrential rains caused the Narmada River to overflow, submerging a bridge and disrupting traffic. Red alerts for intense rainfall and lightning were issued for several districts across Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and Goa.

title: Neena Gupta once recalled Vivian Richards’ reaction to her pregnancy
content: Neena Gupta, currently enjoying a career high, has always been candid about her life, including her relationship with Vivian Richards. She revealed his supportive response when she informed him about her pregnancy, despite societal disapproval of single motherhood at the time. Neena also shared her unique perspective on love, emphasizing the profound bond she shares with her daughter, Masaba.

title: 'Chhaava' actor Viineet and wife blessed with baby boy
content: Viineet Kumar Siingh and his wife, Ruchira Singh, joyfully announced the arrival of their baby boy on July 24, 2025, through an endearing Instagram post. The couple shared a heartwarming message expressing their gratitude and excitement. Celebrities and fans showered them with love and congratulations, celebrating the new addition to their family.

title: Rains lead to closure of tourist spots in Nilgiris; Avalanche dam sluice gates opened
content: Power outages were also reported across many places in Udhagamandalam, Gudalur and Manjoor towns owing to the rains accompanied by heavy winds

title: 72-year-old farmer electrocuted in Kerala’s Palakkad
content: It is suspected that the farmer accidentally stepped on a broken power line on his farmland when he went to collect fallen coconuts

title: Haridwar stampede: Four of six killed in Mansa Devi temple tragedy from Uttar Pradesh
content: Two have been identified as Aarush (12) of Bareilly and Vicky (18) from Rampur. Two others, whose age has not been confirmed yet, included Vakil of Barabanki and Shanti from Budaun

title: Chandrababu Naidu encouraging north Andhra leaders to get coveted posts: Telugu Desam Party
content: Gedela Srinubabu said elevation of former Union Minister P. Ashok Gajapathi Raju as Goa Governor and Srikakulam MP K. Rammohan Naidu as the Union Minister for Civil Aviation indicated the party had extended its wholehearted support to leaders of backward districts

title: PM Modi praises Mani Maran of Saraswathi Mahal Library for preserving ancient manuscripts
content: PM Modi said in every era of the country, there have been people who have dedicated their lives to this cause, and one such inspiring personality was Manimaran from Tamil Nadu’s Thanjavur.

title: Stampede at Haridwar temple failure of system: AAP
content: This is not just an accident, but a failure of the system, and accountability should be fixed, says AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal

title: Jharkhand High Court delivers verdicts pending for years within a week after death row convicts moves SC
content: On July 14, the top court agreed to examine the plea of the convicts and sought a response from the State government and the High Court within a week

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy to visit Nellore on July 31
content: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy to visit SPSR Nellore district, offering support to arrested leaders and boosting party morale

title: Former Speaker Sakthan assumes temporary charge as Thiruvananthapuram DCC president after Palode Ravi resigned over “political gaffe”
content: Palode Ravi had resigned from the post after he came under fire from within the Congress for supposedly broadcasting a defeatist outlook on Congress’ prospects in the upcoming local body elections and the 2026 Assembly polls

title: 'Clerical error' turns M.P. farmer into 'poorest man in India'; income certificate goes viral
content: Officials soon scrambled into action, and by July 25, a new certificate was issued, boosting the farmer's reported annual income to ₹30,000, i.e., ₹2,500 per month.

title: Woman drives car into ditch while using Google Maps for directions; rescued
content: The incident took place at around 1 a.m. on Friday (July 25, 2025)in Belapur area of Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai township

title: Chandrababu Naidu’s Singapore visit strengthens investment prospects for Andhra Pradesh
content: The discussions centered on transformative opportunities across sectors such as defence, electronics, aerospace, green energy, and quantum technologies

title: Raj Thackeray drives to Matoshree to greet Uddhav on his birthday
content: Raj Thackeray drove from his residence Shivteerth in Dadar to Matoshree, Uddhav Thackeray’s residence in Bandra.

title: Parliament Monsoon session: After first week washout, Houses set for fiery debate on Pahalgam attack, Operation Sindoor
content: Both the government and Opposition have consented to a marathon 16-hour debate in each House, which invariably stretches longer in practice.

title: BJD corporator arrested in rape case, suspended from party
content: A senior officer said that Jena was staying in a village in Nilgiri area, which is close to the forest, with the aim of escaping to the jungle if there was any police raid to apprehend him

title: Taxi driver shot in Delhi's Badarpur; two held
content: He was admitted and unconscious. Preliminary investigation revealed that Saini had sustained a gunshot injury to his forehead

title: Andhra Pradesh liquor Scam: SIT searches properties of accused in Hyderabad
content: “Searches are continuing on the properties of Kessireddy Rajashekar Reddy, Buneti Chanikya and Balaji Govindappa, who were in judicial custody,” a senior police officer told The Hindu

title: Drugs seized after raid at party in Pune; Khadse's son-in-law among 7 detained
content: Pranjal Khewalkar, the husband of former Maharashtra Minister Eknath Khadse's daughter Rohini Khadse, was among those detained

title: Surplus water released from Erode Bhavanisagar Dam after reaching full reservoir level
content: According to the Water Resources Department, the dam is storing 28.75 tmc ft of water against its total capacity of 32.8 tmc ft. The inflow at the time of full reservoir level was recorded at 20,427 cusecs

title: Tripura Government asks NHDCL to complete NH repair work before Durga puja
content: PWD secretary Kiran Gitte, along with senior officials of NHIDCL and Tripura PWD, visited the National Highway to take stock of the situation

title: 26.34 lakh ‘ineligible’ beneficiaries will be temporarily suspended under Ladki Bahin scheme
content: The Department of Women and Child Development had sought information from all government departments to verify the eligibility of all applications.

title: Andhra Pradesh Chambers of Commerce & Industry welcomes India-U.K trade agreement
content: As the U.K. gave duty-free access to 99% of Indian exports, sectors such as textiles, gems and jewellery, leather, marine products, agriculture produce, food processing, electronics, chemicals and engineering goods would get a fillip, A.P. Chambers president P. Bhaskar Rao said

title: Parliament to debate Pahalgam terror attack, but terrorists responsible for it are yet to be brought to justice, says Congress
content: In any case this narrative clearly had more takers at home than in countries where an outreach took place, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Arambakkam sexual assault: After two weeks of search, accused arrested
content: On July 12, a minor girl was abducted and raped by an unknown male in a mango grove in Arambakkam, Thiruvallur District, while she was returning from school

title: Mann Ki Baat: New wave of curiosity about space among children; over 200 space startups have come up: PM Modi
content: In his monthly Mann Ki Baat radio broadcast, Mr. Modi said the road to Viksit Bharat passes through self-reliance and 'vocal for local' is the strongest foundation of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'

title: Two major landslips hit Munnar in Idukki; one dies
content: A moving lorry was trapped under the debris and the vehicle driver died and helper sustained injuries

title: 5-year-old girl dies as BMW car rams into two-wheeler in Noida
content: Noida Police arrest two students — Yash Sharma and Abhishek Rawat —  involved in fatal BMW accident, leaving a child dead and two injured

title: Indian-origin man brutally attacked with machete in Australia
content: My instinctive reaction was to bring my arm up to protect my face and wrist. While I was trying to protect myself, the machete just went through my wrist. The second attack, the machete went through my hand..., says Saurabh Anand

title: IMD issues yellow alert for Mumbai, Thane, Palgarh
content: Mumbai witnessed heavy downpour on July 26, with an average rainfall from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. recorded 6.80 mm for Mumbai City

title: Tara Murali, 75, passes away
content: The architect was known for pursuing public causes and promoting civic rights, consumer protection, heritage conservation, and environmentalism

title: Farmer killed in elephant-attack in Chittoor; Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan condoles death, announces ex-gratia
content: As per the information received, the victim, who was on a night vigil, came under the flash attack of the herd, which emerged from the nearby thickets and strayed into the field

title: Haridwar Mansa Devi temple stampede: Six killed, several injured; Uttarakhand CM Dhami orders magisterial probe
content: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said a magisterial probe has been ordered into the incident, and strict action would be taken against those who spread the rumour

title: Vicar accused of sexually abusing minor surrender before Kasaragod court
content: The police launched a State-wide search forming three special investigation teams that traced his possible moments to Chennai, Mangaluru and Mumbai

title: News in Frames | Women’s Business
content: Ima Market in Manipur’s capital Imphal is entirely run by women and hosts 5,000-6,000 vendors, who sell a variety of products catering to needs of the local people as well as tourists; the market stands testimony to the empowerment of women in the State and the socio-economic role they play

title: PM Modi in Tamil Nadu LIVE: PM announces statues for Chola kings Rajaraja, Rajendra at Gangaikonda Cholapuram event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who participated in the valedictory function of  ‘Aadi Thiruvathirai’ festival marking the birth anniversary of King Rajendra Chola, released a commemorative coin of the Tamil emperor in Tamil Nadu

title: NCERT developing special module on Operation Sindoor for classes 3 to 12: Sources
content: The module will have two parts — first for students from class 3 to 8 and another one for students from class 9 to 12.

title: Floods hit Aralam region in Kerala; shutters of Pazhassi dam raised as precaution
content: More than 50 houses were inundated, prompting the emergency relocation of people from the 13th and 11th blocks of the tribal rehabilitation area to the nearby Anganwadis and others to their relatives houses

title: In Tamil Nadu, kidney for sale
content: The unearthing of a kidney-selling racket yet another time in Tamil Nadu last week has decimated the complacency that the State had tamed organ commerce through rigorous implementation of law and enhancing the cadaver donor programme. Serena Josephine M. and M. Sabari dive deep into the present circumstances to understand what needs to change

title: India has ‘greater responsibility’ to support the PKK-Turkey peace process: Pro-Kurdish leader
content: The Co-Chair of the People’s Equality and Democracy Party said that “commercial and cultural exchanges” throughout history have created a continuity between the “Kurdish geography and India” and calls for India’s support

title: Aides of Siddaramaiah, D.K. Shivakumar clash at Delhi’s Karnataka Bhavan
content: The incident involves C. Mohan Kumar, Assistant Resident Commissioner of Karnataka Bhavan, as well as CM Siddaramaiah’s special duty officer (SDO) and H. Anjaneya, SDO to Deputy CM Shivakumar

title: Three missing as boat carrying eight fishermen capsizes in sea in Maharashtra
content: An official said due to heavy rains and rough weather, the boat toppled and started sinking, prompting the fishermen to jump into the water and start swimming to save themselves

title: What makes the NASA-ISRO NISAR satellite so special? | Explained
content: The three-tonne machine has been a decade in the making and costs more than $1.5 billion, making it one of the most expensive earth-observing satellites to date

title: Mahajan Commission report on Karnataka-Maharashtra border row is final, asserts H.K. Patil
content: Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil has said that there was no reason for Kannadigas to be concerned over cases pertaining to the Karnataka-Maharashtra border row before the Supreme Court, as it was a constitutional issue and no decision yet had been taken on taking up the case for hearing

title: Infosys co-founder Shibulal and wife Kumari to build a new cultural centre in south Bengaluru
content: A 20,000 sq.ft art and culture centre is being built by the couple at JP Nagar and it will be operational in about 18 months

title: What does the new U.K.-India trade deal entail? | Explained
content: What are the contours and implications of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement? How will opening up the service sector to the U.K. help India? What is the Double Contribution Convention? When will the trade deal come into effect?

title: Rain fury: 21 houses partially damaged in East Godavari; all tourist spots in ASR district closed
content: No entry to Papikonda National Park and Gudisa grassland till further orders; 4.36 lakh cusecs of flood water being released at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage

title: KTR once proposed merger of BRS with BJP, alleges Anakapalli MP C.M. Ramesh
content: In return, the Telangana leader sought that no cases are registered or investigation made into the scams committed by the BRS government, he alleges

title: Building the perfect trade deadline for the Mets and Phillies
content: New York and Philadelphia are battling for NL East domination. Here's how each can win next week's trade deadline.

title: Zayas, 22, becomes youngest current world champ
content: On Saturday night in New York City, Xander Zayas, 22, became the youngest current world champion by capturing the vacant WBO junior middleweight title with a dominant decision win over Jorge Garcia Perez at the Theater at Madison Square Garden.

title: Shields defends undisputed crown vs. Daniels
content: Claressa Shields successfully defended her undisputed heavyweight crown with a unanimous decision victory versus Lani Daniels on Saturday night.

title: Mariners' Raleigh is 1st in majors with 40 HRs
content: Cal Raleigh became the first player to hit 40 homers this season with a tiebreaking solo shot in the sixth inning against the Angels on Saturday.

title: Judge headed to IL, but 'it could've been worse'
content: New York right fielder Aaron Judge will go on the 10-day injured list with a flexor strain in his right elbow. But in a positive development for the Yankees and their superstar, a scan did not show damage in the two-time MVP's ulnar collateral ligament.

title: Miami coach: Don't agree with Messi ban 'at all'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano suggested MLS wouldn't have suspended Lionel Messi for an away game.

title: Stewart hurts leg 3 minutes in, Liberty fall to L.A.
content: Liberty star Breanna Stewart left the team's 101-99 loss to the Sparks on Saturday night after 3 minutes with a lower leg injury.

title: Yanks continue to deal, get utility man Rosario
content: The Yankees acquired utility man Amed Rosario from the Nationals in exchange for two minor league prospects on Saturday.

title: 12-year-old debuts at world swim championships
content: The globe got its first look on Sunday at 12-year-old Chinese prodigy swimmer Yu Zidi, making her debut at the swimming world championships.

title: 🏈 Iconic alternate CFB uniforms of past 25 years
content: We handed out nominations to some of the best, worst and wildest alternate uniforms donned by college football teams over the past quarter century.

title: Over 14,000 Men Received Money Under Maharashtra's 'Ladki Bahin' Scheme
content: Over 14,000 men fraudulently received financial benefits under the Ladki Bahin Yojana, a scheme explicitly meant for economically disadvantaged women in Maharashtra.

title: Over 14,000 Men Received Money Under Maharashtra's 'Ladki Bahin' Scheme
content: Over 14,000 men fraudulently received financial benefits under the Ladki Bahin Yojana, a scheme explicitly meant for economically disadvantaged women in Maharashtra.

title: The Chola Temple That PM Modi Visited Was Built A Millennium Ago
content: The Gangaikonda Cholapuram Temple was built by the Chola emperor Rajendra I and completed in 1035 CE to commemorate his victorious northern expedition.

title: ChatGPT Co-Creator Shengjia Zhao Joins Meta As Chief Scientist Of Superintelligence Lab
content: Meta Platforms has appointed Shengjia Zhao, co-creator of ChatGPT, as chief scientist of its Superintelligence Lab, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said on Friday, as the company accelerates its push into advanced AI.

title: "Chapters Of India's Soul": PM Modi Launches Mission For Digitisation Of Ancient Manuscripts
content: PM Modi stated that under the Gyan Bharatam Mission, a National Digital Repository will be created after the digitisation of the ancient manuscripts.

title: PM Modi Offers Prayers At Gangaikonda Cholapuram Temple In Tamil Nadu
content: The police made security arrangements and other preparations ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Gangaikonda Cholapuram Temple in Tamil Nadu's Ariyalur.

title: UP Boy Electrocuted. Locals Say Power Officials Didn't Fix Transformer Gate
content: A seven-year-old boy was electrocuted in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow when he came in contact with a transformer in his neighbourhood, the damaged gate to which had not been repaired despite repeated complaints by residents of the area.

title: Who Will Inherit Princess Diana's Childhood Home? Not Prince William, Harry
content: Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Harry, inherited many of her belongings and financial assets after her death in 1997. But her childhood home, the Althorp estate, will not pass to either of them.

title: 6 Dead, Several Injured In Stampede At Haridwar's Mansa Devi Temple
content: Six people have died and dozens of devotees suffered injuries in a stampede at the Mansa Devi temple in the holy city of Haridwar in Uttarakhand. The stampede occurred on the staircases on the temple road leading to the main temple.

title: "Declare Meat, Fruits, Soil": US' Warning To People Travelling With Food At Airport
content: A post on X showed a detection dog inspecting a cooked pig's head wrapped in foil, along with bottles of what looked like other food items.

title: What Led To Stampede At Haridwar's Mansa Devi Temple
content: Soon after the tragic incident, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed grief over the Mansa Devi stampede, saying it was extremely distressing news.

title: "People Jumped Over Others, Ran Over Children": Haridwar Stampede Witness
content: The Mansa Devi temple, a popular pilgrimage site in the holy city of Haridwar in Uttarakhand, was witness to a deadly stampede this morning.

title: "People Jumped With Joy When He Returned": PM Modi Praises Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday expressed pride over the recent achievements by Indians in space, science, sports, and culture while addressing the 124th episode of his monthly radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat.'

title: Odisha Man Posing As Gas Mechanic Enters Varsity, Tries To Rape Professor's Wife
content: The incident took place on Saturday afternoon when the man, posing as an LPG cylinder mechanic, entered the assistant professor's quarters.

title: $300 Million Renovation To Fix 'Potty Parity' Issue For Women US Lawmakers
content: There are only two bathroom stalls for women on the third floor of the Kentucky Statehouse, where the House and Senate chambers are located.

title: Babbar Khalsa-Linked Terrorist, Wanted In Punjab Grenade Attack, Arrested In Delhi
content: Karanbir was linked to the banned Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) outfit and the April 7 attack on Qila Lal Singh Police Station in Batala.

title: MiG-21's Final Flight: Why Training, Not The Jet, Failed Air Force Pilots
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) is preparing to retire its fleet of Russian-origin MiG-21 fighter jets in September. The aircraft played a key role in India's military campaigns, including the 1971 war against Pakistan.

title: "They Should Be Prosecuted": Trump Targets Kamala Harris, Beyonce, Oprah Over 2024 Endorsements
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday (local time) demanded that Kamala Harris and several top American celebrities be prosecuted for allegedly receiving and paying millions of dollars for endorsements during the 2024 presidential election.

title: "Body Sacrifices Own Tissue": Gaza Doctor On The Impact Of Starvation
content: Gaza is now effectively starving. A doctor inside the besieged enclave has now delivered a chilling breakdown of how starvation shuts down the human body, from initial hunger pangs to the collapse of vital organs.

title: New frog from Meghalaya named after Khasi rice dish
content: The Khasi word for ‘frog’ is the name of a second new species, belonging to the genus Raorchestes, recorded by the same team

title: West Bengal demands to see bank statements of aided colleges; institutions see move as blow to autonomy
content: The Finance Department has introduced Fund Information System (FIS) portal from financial year 2025-26 and it is mandatory to provide bank account details and FD details to get any financial assistance

title: West Bengal police launches helpline for migrant workers facing harassment in other States
content: The West Bengal police in the social media post said that the helpline number is 9147727666 which will be available only on WhatsApp and the people can send a message there with the necessary information, including your name and address.

title: Assam’s Foreigners’ Tribunals disregard constitutional safeguards: report
content: Given the possibility of a nationwide exercise to update the National Register of Citizens, the report calls for an urgent, fundamental rethinking of the legal structures governing citizenship in India

title: Opposition up in arms over alleged discrepancies in draft electoral rolls
content: UDF, BJP allege the ‘anomaly’ is part of a concerted effort in connivance with officials to set the ground in favour of CPI(M)

title: Ajit Pawar visit to Pune reignites Opposition charge of ‘flight’ of industries
content:
Congress accuses Mahayuti govt. of presiding over IT companies moving base to other States and cities
after viral video of Deputy CM’s outburst over civic issues during visit to Hinjewadi infotech park

title: Congress targets government over ‘organic cotton scam’, demands probe
content: Congress leader Digvijay Singh alleged that there has been a ₹2.1 lakh crore scam involving ‘fake’ organic cotton and some traders have made six-fold profits; he demanded an investigation into the matter

title: Tamil Nadu’s Gangaikonda Cholapuram decked up to welcome PM Modi; police tighten security ahead of visit
content: PM Modi to participate in the valediction of the Aadi Thiruvathirai festival marking the birth anniversary of Rajendra Chola I and Music composer Ilaiyaraaja to perform a 20-minute concert

title: Panchayat secretary of Inmulnarva village in ACB net
content: The bribe was demanded in return for setting aside a notice issued in connection with a construction carried out by the complainant.

title: India’s rising stature would lead to national security challenges in years to come: Home Minister Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah was speaking at the conclusion of the two-day 8th National Security Strategies (NSS) Conference-2025 organised by the Intelligence Bureau (IB), which was attended by 800 police and intelligence officers

title: Revanth calls for revival of ideology-driven politics, recalls Jaipal Reddy’s contribution to politics
content: Chief Minister recalled the political and administrative reforms initiated by Jaipal Reddy during his tenure as Union Minister

title: Study recommends two half-dose combination of drugs in a single pill for good blood pressure control in Indians
content: All three combinations, in patients aged 30–79, delivered equivalent BP reductions and similar rates of BP control, researchers said; all combinations were equally safe and effective with high tolerability over six months, they wrote in the paper

title: Air India disburses interim compensation to families of Ahmedabad crash victims
content: Compensation paid to kin of 166 victims; process under way for remaining 52; airline sets up memorial trust

title: Vellappally Natesan slams Satheeshan
content: The SNDP Yogam general secretary calls the Opposition leader anti-Ezhava and says he is not capable of leading the UDF

title: BJP slams SP MLA for saying that only illiterate people go on Kanwar Yatra
content: The Samajwadi Party is once again attempting to stoke division in a desperate bid to stay politically relevant, alleged the BJP

title: Trinamool Congress MP refutes Haryana CM charge against Bengal CM on migrant workers
content: Trinamool Congress MP and chairperson of West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board Samirul Islam on Saturday says a witch-hunt is going on against migrants in the name of ‘Bangladeshis’

title: Tej Pratap Yadav to contest Bihar Assembly election as independent candidate from Mahua
content: Following a recent controversy involving a video of his relationship with a woman, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav’s elder son was expelled from the party, and ousted from his family

title: PM Modi inaugurates projects worth ₹4,900 crore in Tamil Nadu
content: Prime Minister Modi launches multiple projects in Tamil Nadu, including new airport terminal, extended runway, and cargo berthing facility

title: Thiruvananthapuram DCC president Palode Ravi resigns after leaked phone call embarrasses party
content: The discussion about the possibility of the LDF returning to power again in 2026 and the BJP striking deeper, making electoral gains in the Assembly elections, puts the Congress on the defensive. The tape also had disparaging predictions about the Congress faring poorly in the local body polls later this year

title: Reports on officials, religion, protests land journalists in trouble; those in towns most impacted, finds study
content: A study said that a journalist’s experience of the justice system differed based on location and status. Journalists in major metropolises were arrested in 24% of the incidents, this increased to 58% for journalists in small cities and towns.

title: Defending need for SIR in the Supreme Court, Election Commission cites parties’ complaints about voter list errors
content: In its counter affidavit filed in the SC, the ECI cites complaints made by AAP, Congress, BJP, AIADMK, Shiv Sena; ECI says it began the SIR “to restore puiblic confidence in the integrity of the electoral roll”

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team
content: Supercell has announced that it has partnered with Travis Hunter for the summer jam . the event is designed to help players get their villages back into shape . Hunter is a highly respected athlete, but also an active Clash of Clans player . it is set to last until Aug. 1 .

title: Has Arsenal created another goalkeeper conundrum?
content: Kepa Arrizabalaga joined arsenal from Valencia in a surprise move . the spaniard spent the 2023-24 campaign at real madrid . he was ostensibly a replacement for Thibaut Courtois after a knee injury .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: Wiegman, the major tournament magician, is in yet another final. How does she do it?
